summary.para: Clears the handler for timer client status change events.

returns.para: If the method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code. See Windows Animation Error Codes for a list of error codes.

summary.para: Handles update events from the timer.

param.name: timeNow
param.para: The current timer time, in seconds.

param.name: result
param.para: Receives a member of the enumeration, indicating whether any animation variables changed as a result of the update.

returns.para: If the method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code. See Windows Animation Error Codes for a list of error codes.

remarks.para: This method is used by the UIAnimationTimer object to update the state of the UIAnimationManager object. The UIAnimationTimer object calls only when calls to this method return a result of UI_ANIMATION_UPDATE_VARIABLES_CHANGED.

summary.para: Specifies a handler for timer client status change events.

param.name: handler
param.para: A handler for timer client events. The specified object must implement .

returns.para: If the method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code. See Windows Animation Error Codes for a list of error codes.

remarks.para: If the update handler is already connected to the timer, this method returns UI_E_TIMER_CLIENT_ALREADY_CONNECTED.

summary.para: Defines methods for handling timing update events.

remarks.para: The UIAnimationManager object implements this interface, so a client application can query the UIAnimationManager object for this interface and then pass the interface to . It is not necessary to disconnect the UIAnimationManager and UIAnimationTimer objects; releasing them both is sufficient to clean up.
